commit_list.message: Initial commit
Show cop names
Don't police the tmp dir

Merge pull request #1 from mrchucho/feature/rubocop

Feature/rubocop
The CI process should also run the Rails cops.

Misunderstood how lint/rails included/exlcuded cops.

Basically --lint _only_ runs the lint cops, while --rails _also_
runs the Rails cops. So, if we really want to do **everything** then
we need to include --rails. Therefore, it's not necessary to have
Rails-only task.
Bumped version, set a homepage
Added the checkstyle_formatter for using rubocop w/ Jenkins
Rubocop tasks
Ran rubocop on the gem itself!
No test or exec. files, don't bother looking

Use system instead of %x{} so we see all the output.

Helpful for Jenkins.

commit_list.message:
Use a factory-style Logic creator.

The actual logic is all in lib/logic, but isn't "exposed" to the
rest of the engine. Ideally, this sets you up to load logic from
template files. Also, the factory encapsulates setting the logic
owner in a succinct way.

Reporter is a special case "logic"
